Method Summary
 IAgentDescription[] getAgentDescriptions()
          There are two ways of describing an agent, the get-/setDescription-methods deal with a 'human-readable' description, the get-/setAgentDescription-methods on the other hand deal with the FIPA-agentdescription, which is more technical and used for registering and searching for agents at the directory facilitator for example.

getAgentDescriptions

IAgentDescription[] getAgentDescriptions()
There are two ways of describing an agent, the get-/setDescription-methods deal with a 'human-readable' description, the get-/setAgentDescription-methods on the other hand deal with the FIPA-agentdescription, which is more technical and used for registering and searching for agents at the directory facilitator for example.

Returns:
the agentType's AgentDescriptionModel.

getToolOptions

IToolOption[] getToolOptions()
Get the tool-options of this runnable model.

Returns:
runnable agentinstance's tool-options or null, if it has no tool-options

boolean hasToolOption(java.lang.String typeName)
Check if a toolOption is set.

Parameters:
typeName - toolOption's type-name.
Returns:
'true' if tooloption is set, 'false' otherwise.

setToolOptions

void setToolOptions(IToolOption[] toolOptions)
Set the tool options. This method may only be used by the RunnableFactory !!!

Parameters:
toolOptions - A HashMap containing the name of the toolOption as key and the properties (String-Array) as value.

Get an agent's parameter.

Parameters:
name - The parameter's name.
Returns:
an agent's parameter.

getParameters

IParameter[] getParameters()
Get all of the agent's parameters. The returned HashMap has parameter-names as keys and the parameter's attributes as values. The Attributes of a parameter are represented by a HashMap. Possible keys in this HashMap are name, type, optional, description, value, constraints . So, this method returns a HashMap with name-String as key and attribute-HashMap as value.

Returns:
All of the agent's parameters.

setParameters

void setParameters(IParameter[] newParameters)
Set the parameters. This method may only be used by the RunnableFactory !!!

Parameters:
newParameters - An Array of new parameters, overwriting the current ones.

getParameterSet

IParameterSet getParameterSet(java.lang.String name)
Get an agent's parameter set. Possible keys in this HashMap are name, type, optional, description, value, constraints .

Parameters:
name - The parameter's name.
Returns:
an agent's parameter.

getParameterSets

IParameterSet[] getParameterSets()
Get all agent-parameter-sets.

Returns:
The agent's parameter-sets.

setParameterSets

void setParameterSets(IParameterSet[] newParameterSets)
Set the parameterSets. This method may only be used by the RunnableFactory !!!

Parameters:
newParameterSets - An Array of new parameterSets, overwriting the current ones.
